data.meaning_mnemonic: The <radical>leader</radical> has a <radical>book</radical> all about the human <kanji>body</kanji>. Knowing about bodies is a privilege. One that only leaders get—it helps them control all their subjects, like you.
data.meaning_hint: Imagine looking down at your body and thinking, huh, I wonder what all that junk is? Oh well, I'm sure the leader has it all figured out in that book of hers.
data.reading_mnemonic: The leader's <kanji>body</kanji> book also taught her about something very body specific: how to tie a <reading>tie</reading> (たい). You can't have a tie on your body, no no. Those are for the leader and her smart body.
data.reading_hint: Picture the leader, reading a book, putting a tie on her body. Look around at you and your family and your neighbors. You don't know what your body meat-bags do and you don't know how to tie a tie. Womp womp.
